properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain continues early this morning. Freezing rain has developed early this morning in the Ottawa Valley area. Several hours of freezing rain are possible before temperatures rise above the freezing mark this morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T17:59:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-17T10:07:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1410694552.2020
Area: Gatineau, Prescott and Russell, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orl√©ans
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR BURNS LAKE (March 16, 2020 - Smithers) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued a Road Dust Advisory for Burns Lake because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-03-17T22:33:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-03-17T06:34:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1714670771.2020
Area: Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The passage of a cold front has brought strong northwest winds gusting up to 70 km/h. In Arviat, these winds are creating blizzard conditions with near zero visibilities in blowing snow and will continue until Tuesday morning. In Baker Lake, winds are expected to strengthen later this afternoon to create blizzard conditions with poor visibilities in blowing snow and end before morning. Additionally, blowing snow continues to persist through the rest of the Kivalliq over the next few days with visibilities dropping lower than 1 km at times. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T11:26:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T19:27:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3952859757.2020
Area: Baker Lake, Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief, intense snowfall is expected to develop. Under the snow squall, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-18T00:15:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-17T08:15:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1664637495.2020

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this evening and tonight. Snow, at times heavy, will continue into tonight for areas from Wawa to Montreal River while snow from Marathon to Wawa will taper off this evening. Total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are possible by the time the snow comes to an end with the highest amounts expected along the Lake Superior shoreline. Be prepared to adjust your driving with quickly changing travel conditions. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T12:18:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T20:19:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1897649731.2020
Area: Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow giving total accumulations of close to 15 cm is expected today. Snow combined with strong winds will cause blowing snow in the most exposed areas. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds gusting to 90 kilometres per hour are expected today. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
